name: Diagnosis Related Group
description: The Diagnosis Related Group segment (DRG) contains information used to categorize hospital inpatients with similar clinical conditions and resource utilization patterns for reimbursement purposes. This segment is critical for hospital billing, quality reporting, case mix analysis, and Medicare/Medicaid reimbursement. It supports various DRG classification systems including MS-DRG, APR-DRG, and international variations.

cardinality.note: DRG provides reimbursement classification when inpatient billing is required

DRG.1.name: Diagnostic Related Group
DRG.1.description: This field contains the DRG code assigned to the patient's stay.
DRG.1.generationHint: DRG code with coding system identifier

DRG.2.name: DRG Assigned Date/Time
DRG.2.description: This field contains the date and time when the DRG was assigned.
DRG.2.generationHint: Format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS for DRG assignment timestamp

DRG.3.name: DRG Approval Indicator
DRG.3.description: This field indicates whether the DRG assignment has been approved.

DRG.4.name: DRG Grouper Review Code
DRG.4.description: This field contains the review code from the DRG grouper software.

DRG.5.name: Outlier Type
DRG.5.description: This field indicates the type of outlier designation for reimbursement.

DRG.6.name: Outlier Days
DRG.6.description: This field contains the number of outlier days for day outliers.
DRG.6.generationHint: Number of days beyond expected length of stay

DRG.7.name: Outlier Cost
DRG.7.description: This field contains the outlier cost amount for cost outliers.

DRG.8.name: DRG Payor
DRG.8.description: This field identifies the payor for whom the DRG assignment was made.

DRG.9.name: Outlier Reimbursement
DRG.9.description: This field contains the additional reimbursement amount for outliers.

DRG.10.name: Confidential Indicator
DRG.10.description: This field indicates whether the DRG information is confidential.

DRG.11.name: DRG Transfer Type
DRG.11.description: This field indicates the type of transfer affecting DRG reimbursement.

notes: DRG segments are essential for inpatient reimbursement and case mix reporting
Different DRG classification systems (MS-DRG, APR-DRG) have different coding structures
Outlier designations significantly impact reimbursement amounts
DRG assignment depends on principal diagnosis, procedures, complications, and demographics
Transfer types affect DRG payments and must be accurately documented
Quality reporting often relies on DRG-based risk adjustment
Confidential indicators protect sensitive cases in psychiatric and substance abuse treatment

dataConsistency.outlierCoherence: DRG.5, DRG.6, DRG.7, DRG.9 must be consistent for outlier scenarios
dataConsistency.payorAlignment: DRG.8 should align with insurance information in IN1/IN2 segments
dataConsistency.dateValidation: DRG.2 should be within or after the admission date
dataConsistency.transferLogic: DRG.11 should align with admission and discharge information

businessRules.reimbursementAccuracy: DRG codes must align with ICD-10 diagnoses and procedures
businessRules.outlierThresholds: Outlier calculations must follow CMS guidelines
businessRules.qualityReporting: DRG assignments support quality measure calculations
businessRules.caseMixAnalysis: DRG data enables hospital case complexity analysis
